001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
004import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
005import java.util.Arrays;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Objects;
008import java.util.function.Function;
009import java.util.stream.Collectors;
010
011/**
012 * Utility-class to work with properties of any Java-object (some extension to JDK's reflection)
013 */
014public class CorePropsUtils {
015
016    /**
017     * Comparing on equality of the same property of two objects of the same type.
018     *
019     * @param objOne the first object
020     * @param objTwo the second object
021     * @param getterFunc the reference to getter-method
022     * @return {@code true} if the properties are equal or both are eventually {@code null} (and otherwise - {@code false})
023     * @param <T> the type of both objects
024     * @param <V> the type of properties (that is inferred once the method reference is provided)
025     */
026    public static <T, V> boolean equalProps(T objOne, T objTwo, Function<T, V> getterFunc) {
027        V propOne = objOne == null ? null : getterFunc.apply(objOne);
028        V propTwo = objTwo == null ? null : getterFunc.apply(objTwo);
029        return Objects.equals(propOne, propTwo);
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * The same as {@link #propValue(Object, String...)}, but cast the final value to string,
034     * or transform that value using standard {@link String#valueOf(Object)}
035     * (which is the same as invoking {@link Object#toString()} on that object)
036     *
037     * @param parent the root value to start the property-chain
038     * @param propNameChain the chain of nested property-names
039     * @return the value of the last property in that property-chain as {@link String}
040     */
041    public static String propValueStr(Object parent, String... propNameChain) {
042        Object propValueObj = propValue(parent, propNameChain);
043        return propValueObj == null ? null : String.valueOf(propValueObj);
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Getting the value of nested properties of <b>{@code th-tool}</b>-variable by providing the chain of property-names,
048     * which is quite the same as Thymeleaf-Engine does when processing the expression
049     * of form {@code ${varName.propName.nestedPropName...}}. At the moment only nested objects
050     * of type {@link Map Map&lt;String,Object&gt;} are supported.
051     *
052     * @param parent the root value to start the property-chain
053     * @param propNameChain the chain of nested property-names
054     * @return the value of the last property in that property-chain
055     */
056    @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
057    public static Object propValue(Object parent, String... propNameChain) {
058        Object value = parent;
059        for (int propNameIndex = 0; propNameIndex < propNameChain.length; propNameIndex++) {
060            String propName = propNameChain[propNameIndex];
061            if (value instanceof Map parentMap) {
062                value = parentMap.get(propName);
063            } else {
064                // all values except the last one are expected to be maps
065                throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
066                    "Could not resolve the property-chain '%s' - the tail '%s' is unresolved " +
067                        "(the value of '%s' is expected to be a Map, but %s).",
068                    propChainStr(propNameChain),
069                    propChainTailStr(propNameIndex, propNameChain),
070                    propChainHeadStr(propNameIndex, propNameChain),
071                    wrongValueDescription(value)
072                ));
073            }
074        }
075        return value;
076    }
077
078    private static String wrongValueDescription(Object value) {
079        return value == null ? "it's null" : String.format("it's of type <<%s>>", value.getClass());
080    }
081
082    private static String propChainStr(String... propChain) {
083        return propChainStr(0, propChain.length, propChain);
084    }
085
086    private static String propChainHeadStr(int propIndex, String... propChain) {
087        return propChainStr(0, propIndex, propChain);
088    }
089
090    private static String propChainTailStr(int propIndex, String... propChain) {
091        return propChainStr(propIndex, propChain.length, propChain);
092    }
093
094    private static String propChainStr(int indexFrom, int indexTo, String... propChain) {
095        return Arrays.stream(propChain, indexFrom, indexTo).collect(Collectors.joining("."));
096    }
097
098    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
099
100    /**
101     * A helper method that allows to instantiate any class with empty-constructor
102     * without necessity to handle multiple checked exceptions
103     *
104     * @param classToCreate a class to create an instance of
105     * @return the instance of class {@code classToCreate}
106     * @param <T> the type of class to create an instance of
107     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if instantiation is impossible by JDK's or JVM's reasons
108     */
109    public static <T> T newInstance(Class<T> classToCreate) {
110        try {
111            Constructor<T> defaultConstructor = classToCreate.getDeclaredConstructor();
112            defaultConstructor.setAccessible(true);
113            return defaultConstructor.newInstance();
114        } catch (NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException | InvocationTargetException
115                | InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException ex) {
116            if (ex.getCause() instanceof RuntimeException runtimeCauseEx) {
117                throw runtimeCauseEx;
118            }
119            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot instantiate a class " + classToCreate.getName(), ex);
120        }
121    }
122
123    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
124
125    private CorePropsUtils() {
126        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
127        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
128    }
129}
